title: Thoughts on Ornn's voice
body:
Do you think he has a voice that is understandable? 
Sure on the one hand we have the theory that he has siblings and one og them is Lissandra. This would say that he has a voice.
But the song used an old language, maybe he is such an old god that he can't speak the "new languages " of Runterra?

replies.body: wait what? did i miss something? when did he and liss became siblings
its a theory, becasue he has siblings

I have yet to see anyone of the boards accurately guess who Ornns siblings are

;)
A few posts I've read have guessed a couple...
Can you at least say how many of them are in the game now?

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P710AxBk,comment-id=00000000000000100001,timestamp=2017-08-07T02:17:50.293+0000)
>
> Can you at least say how many of them are in the game now?

Sounds like that would give too much away.

> [{quoted}](name=FauxSchizzle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P710AxBk,comment-id=000000000000001000010000,timestamp=2017-08-07T03:34:48.902+0000)
>
> Sounds like that would give too much away.

If you had to compare Ornn to one Game of Thrones character, personality or appearance wise, who would it be?
There isn't one that immediately springs to mind for Ornn.
Well since I posted this, sure :)
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/Z4knRJEe-ornn-and-what-ornn-might-be
Maybe our resident ice birb?

I think that one of his siblings are in the game while the other is elsewhere. I think that one of them is brand. Because remember brand is a  fire spirit. And considering that this guy is supposedly a "god" maybe he put brand there to punish him for his misdeeds. Plus he is the Mountainsmith, i doubt that someone who forges mountains would have a sibling that's one. More that likely he made Malphite for some reason.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P710AxBk,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-06T16:32:26.772+0000)
>
> I have yet to see anyone of the boards accurately guess who Ornns siblings are
> 
> ;)

Quick, guess EVERYTHING!

* Ghosts
* Giant balloon animals
* James K. Polk and Zachary Taylor
* Mattress salesmen
* ...

But, more seriously, I think we don't know enough about Runeterra's lore (or Ornn's specifically) to make accurate guesses yet. If I had to guess from existing lore, I'd say Braum -- he's old enough that a Grandmother tells a child stories of him that HER grandmother told HER, and they have a similar mythical quality to them. We've heard Ornn is a massively sized character, but size doesn't necessarily relate to family connection for legendary figures.
But Braum has already been guessed at many times on these boards......
maybe its anivia lmao. she's a mythical creature i think in her lore revamp

Mountain forger...

Any relation to {{champion:54}} in the new lore?
Olaf, Tryndamere, Udyr.
It's gonna be something troll like {{champion:432}} or {{champion:16}} isn't it >:)
not gragas, a riot person said that he is related to gragas but not as a sibling in my thread
Oh right, didn't look up at it after I posted there

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P710AxBk,comment-id=00000000000000020000,timestamp=2017-08-06T16:55:33.122+0000)
>
> But Braum has already been guessed at many times on these boards......

is one of the sibblings a champion or just a person in the lore?

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P710AxBk,comment-id=00000000000000020000,timestamp=2017-08-06T16:55:33.122+0000)
>
> But Braum has already been guessed at many times on these boards......

I haven't read many of the comments, but yeah -- he would definitely be guessed a lot. I just think we don't have enough information yet to do more than vaguely speculate though...and it's possible we've never even HEARD of these siblings in lore yet anyway. :P
It's Anivia
Is it Gregor the ghost from the howling abyss?

Well, if we list out the potentially legendary creatures/animals/etc. in LoL lore that we don't already know the exact origins of, we have:

{{champion:34}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:427}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:223}}

Of all of these, I believe the most likely are:

{{champion:34}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:427}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:223}} 

Anivia is an incredibly old creature in the Freljord that has seemingly survived for thousands, if not millions, if not billions of years. I believe it was implied somewhere once that Anivia was still alive before Gnar was frozen in ice.
Braum, if I recall, has lived longer than most mortals. His legends stretch back pretty far, so he has the potential to be a sibling, even if they don't really share the animal-ish characteristic part.
When I say Ivern, I less mean Ivern himself, and more the World Tree. Not sure how demigods work, so perhaps the tree was a sibling to Ornn. The more I think about it, the weirder and less likely it sounds though.
Malphite has yet to have any of his lore explained and since Ornn and him share a theme of "Earth-oriented mega beings", I wouldn't write it off for them being related in some way.
Rammus is a legendary creature within Shurima that shares the animal similarity with Ornn (Ornn is clearly a ram-like creature by the way). Not to mention that, while Rammus is much more so of this, Ornn doesn't seem to speak in too complex of sentences.
Soraka is the most likely in my mind. Soraka is a goat-like creature that descended from her immortal nature to help humans (at least in the old lore she did). Rams and goats are in a similar general family of animals, plus Soraka is one of the few other demigod-like characters in League, so I wouldn't be surprised at all if Soraka is a sibling.
Finally, we have Tahm Kench. If we are going for the whole "each demigod/god represents an emotion, element, etc. of the world" then Tahm Kench fits in perfectly as the demigod/god of gluttony. This seems like a natural fit as a distant relative or sibling to Ornn, although I wouldn't be surprised if Tahm wasn't related at all.

So, if I were to guess, I would say Soraka is his sibling if a sibling is currently present in the game. 

Also, Ornn's title as a "demigod" does make me wonder... are there mortals and gods that live close enough together for a demigod to appear? I mean, I'm not sure how this would happen since I think I read somewhere Ornn was around when Avarosa and her sisters became Iceborn, meaning the only potential gods in the Freljord at least that could have birthed Ornn were Watchers, which seems off to me.
How about I go out on a limb, and say Udy'r/ Volibear's spirits.
We don't even know what he is lol
Avarosa and Ivern
Doesn't Jinx have a sister?
Varus Aatrox Rhaast
Willump?
Brand Anivia Braum
Tryndame... OMG! NO WAY! Co-founders are too many OP in this new lore...
Inb4 poros
What about the Watchers?
Brand..?

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P710AxBk,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-06T16:32:26.772+0000)
>
> I have yet to see anyone of the boards accurately guess who Ornns siblings are
> 
> ;)

{{champion:54}}

Let me take few guesses:

Option 1: He is a celestial being and his siblings are other celestial beings like Bard, Soraka or Aurelion Sol (I don´t mean that he is related with every other celestial being (which still could be possible) but that he might be with some few). That´s based on what Sharjo told us about him (Freljordians **think** he is a god and him being very large and powerful.

Option 2: He is some kind of Freljordian spirit and is a sibling of Anivia (again because he is quite powerful). (unlikely and I don´t believe in this option).

Option 3: His siblings aren´t in the game now. Neither as a champion nor mentioned in the item/map (for example Doran who made the starting items or a shopkeeper on a map) lore. (lame option and again I don´t really believe in this option)

***
Now to other theories. I somehow think that Ornn crafted the runes and not only runes, he crafted almost everything (landscapes etc.). And he probably had something to do with Brand (Brand was in a cave covered with runes).
thats just lore stuff, but does he has a understandable language?

im gona throw some into the ring then tbh 

{{champion:1}} ,{{champion:33}} , and {{champion:141}}

I think he would have understandable voice. I invision him as Titanic keeper from WoW. A massive dude, who's Mountainsmith, eh, I hope he have understandable voice. With added a bit of ambient effect in his lines.
It also would be cool to hear his song in-game now and then
